item.title: Report X-2023120411
item.description:
Report X-2023120411

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-18T21:10:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the box on the belt of the 200 line about 10:30 The box was wet and had two, one-gallon bottles inside. Both appeared to be undamaged. The box, packing slip and op900 all stated 4x one gallon. The only spillage was inside the box. This was put in a hazmat bag and will be discarded. DescribePack: The bottles I have in my possession appear to be undamaged. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: box was put in hazmat bag

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The manager found the box with a wet corner and called QA. We secured the package in a lined red tote. DescribePack: The cap became loose causing an internal leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: We secured the hazmat in a lined red tote and tightened the cap.

item.title: Report E-2023120119
item.description:
Report E-2023120119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a liter release of UN1210 printing ink was released due to a forklift puncture on a trailer. The release was contained to a deck board on the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was decided the staff was able to clean the spill with PPE on hand , the majority of the material had evaporated (only 2-3 teaspoons on deck board when caller notified ERTS), and there was sufficient ventilation on dock to handle the spill. The terminal applied water to the deck boards and pick up material with an absorbent (Oil dri), the break down of the deck board was containerized and all waste and debris was placed into a 110-gallon DM and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
